SEARCH
Package com.example.dangle_lotto

Class FirebaseManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.dangle_lotto.FirebaseManager
public class FirebaseManager extends Object
FirebaseManager — handles all Firebase-related operations for authentication, users, and events.

This class serves as a data manager for Firestore and Firebase Authentication, handling creation, retrieval, update, and deletion (CRUD) operations for both users and events. It also manages bidirectional relationships between users and events via subcollections.

Since:
2025-11-01

    • signIn

      public void signIn(String email, String password, FirebaseCallback<String> callback)
      Signing in a user with email and password. Send uid to callback function if successful.
      Parameters:
      email - Email of the user
      password - Password of the user
      callback - Callback function to call when user is created

    • signUp

      public void signUp(String email, String password, String name, String username, String phone, String photo_id, boolean canOrganize, FirebaseCallback<String> callback)
      Create new user in the database and instantiates a user object with all required attributes.

      Pass null into phone and photo_id if user has decided not to provide that information.

      Parameters:
      email - Email of the user
      password - Password of the user
      name - Name of the user
      username - Username of the user
      phone - Phone number of the user - set null if not provided
      photo_id - Photo id for user profile picture - set null if not provided
      canOrganize - Boolean value indicating whether the user can organize events
      callback - Callback function to call when user is created

    • getNotificationsForUser

      public void getNotificationsForUser(String uid, FirebaseCallback<List<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot>> callback)
      Retrieves all notifications for the specified user, ordered by most recent first.
      Parameters:
      uid - UID of the user whose notifications are requested
      callback - Callback returning a list of notification documents on success

    • getAllUsers

      public void getAllUsers(FirebaseCallback<ArrayList<String>> callback)
      Fetches the UIDs of all users in the database.
      Parameters:
      callback - Callback returning a list of user IDs on success

    • createNewUser

      public void createNewUser(String uid, String name, String username, String email, String phone, String pid, boolean canOrganize)
      Creates and stores a new user document in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      uid - Firebase Auth user ID.
      name - User name.
      username - Username of the user
      email - User email.
      phone - User phone number (nullable).
      pid - Profile photo ID (nullable).
      canOrganize - Whether the user can organize events.

    • getDeviceId

      public static String getDeviceId(android.content.Context context)
      Returns a unique device ID for the current Android device.

      This ID is used to identify the device for auto-login purposes.

      Parameters:
      context - Context of the calling component.
      Returns:
      A string representing the device's unique Android ID.

    • setDeviceIdForUser

      public void setDeviceIdForUser(String uid, String deviceId, FirebaseCallback<Void> callback)
      Sets or updates the DeviceId field for a given user in Firestore.

      Used to bind a device to a user for device-based auto-login.

      Parameters:
      uid - UID of the user to update.
      deviceId - The device ID to associate with this user.
      callback - Callback to handle success, failure, and completion events.

    • updateUserNotificationStatus

      public void updateUserNotificationStatus(String uid, boolean enabled, FirebaseCallback<Void> callback)
      Sets or updates the notification status for a given user in Firestore.

      Used to enable or disable notifications for the user.

      Parameters:
      uid - UID of the user to update.
      enabled - True if notifications should be enabled, false otherwise.
      callback - Callback to handle success, failure, and completion events.

    • getUserByDeviceId

      public void getUserByDeviceId(String deviceId, FirebaseCallback<String> callback)
      Retrieves the UID of a user associated with a given device ID.

      Used for device-based auto-login to identify the user linked to the current device.

      Parameters:
      deviceId - The device ID to search for in Firestore.
      callback - Callback to handle success (returns UID) or failure.

    • updateUser

      public void updateUser(User userObj, String name, String username, String newEmail, String phone, String photo_id, String password, FirebaseCallback<Boolean> callback)
      Updates an existing user’s data in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      userObj - User object containing updated fields.
      name - New name.
      username - New username.
      newEmail - New email.
      phone - New phone number.
      photo_id - New profile photo ID.
      password - New password.

    • makeUserAdmin

      public void makeUserAdmin(String uid, FirebaseCallback<Boolean> callback)
      Makes the specified user an admin by setting isAdmin = true.
      Parameters:
      uid - UID of the user to update.
      callback - Callback for success/failure.

    • updateUserLocation

      public void updateUserLocation(String uid, com.google.firebase.firestore.GeoPoint location)
      Updates a user's location in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      uid - User ID
      location - Location to update to

    • deleteUser

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteUser(String uid)
      Deletes a user and all related data from Firestore. Removes references from all events and subcollections the user participated in or organized.
      Parameters:
      uid - User ID to delete.

    • getUser

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> getUser(String uid, FirebaseCallback<User> callback)
      Retrieves a User by UID from Firestore. May be a GeneralUser or AdminUser
      Parameters:
      uid - User ID.
      callback - Callback that receives the retrieved user object.

    • revokeOrganizer

      public void revokeOrganizer(String uid)
      Revokes a user's organizer permissions by setting their CanOrganize field to false.
      Parameters:
      uid - UID of the user to update

    • grantOrganizer

      public void grantOrganizer(String uid)
      Grants organizer permissions to a user by setting their CanOrganize field to true.
      Parameters:
      uid - UID of the user to update

    • getAllEvents

      public void getAllEvents(FirebaseCallback<ArrayList<String>> callback)
      Retrieves all event document IDs from Firestore.
      Parameters:
      callback - Callback returning a list of event IDs or an error

    • createEvent

      public Event createEvent(String oid, String name, com.google.firebase.Timestamp start_date, com.google.firebase.Timestamp end_date, com.google.firebase.Timestamp event_date, String location, Boolean location_required, String description, int eventSize, int maxEntrants, String photo_url, String qr_url, ArrayList<String> categories)
      Creates and uploads a new event document to Firestore.
      Parameters:
      oid - Organizer ID.
      name - Event name.
      start_date - Event start date.
      end_date - Event end date.
      event_date - Event timestamp.
      location - Event location.
      location_required - Whether the location is required to sign up for event.
      description - Event description.
      eventSize - Event size limit.
      maxEntrants - Maximum number of registrants.
      photo_url - Event photo URL for reference into firebase storage. Null if no photo provided.
      categories - List of event categories.
      Returns:
      Instantiated Event object.

    • updateEvent

      public void updateEvent(Event event)
      Updates event data in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      event - The event object containing updated values.

    • deleteEvent

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteEvent(String eid)
      Deletes an event from the database. Recursively goes through all users the event has been registered for and also deletes all of those references. Waits for the asynchronous calls to complete before deleting the event at the end.
      Parameters:
      eid - string of user id to search for and retrieve all attributes

    • documentToEvent

      public Event documentToEvent(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot doc)
      Converts a Firestore document snapshot into an Event object.
      Parameters:
      doc - The Firestore document snapshot.
      Returns:
      An instantiated Event object.

    • getEvent

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> getEvent(String eid, FirebaseCallback<Event> callback)
      Retrieves an event from the database and instantiates an object for it.
      Parameters:
      eid - string of user id to search for and retrieve all attributes
      callback - callback function to call when event is retrieved

    • createNotification

      public void createNotification(String senderId, String receiverId, String message, Boolean isFromAdmin)
      Creates a notification document in the database.
      Parameters:
      senderId - sender id (can either be a user id or event id)
      receiverId - receiver id (only a uid)
      message - message to send to user
      isFromAdmin - whether the notification is from an admin

    • notiDocToNoti

      public Notification notiDocToNoti(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot nDoc)
      Converts a Firestore document snapshot into a Notification object.
      Parameters:
      nDoc - The Firestore document snapshot.
      Returns:
      An instantiated Notification object.

    • getUserSubcollection

      public void getUserSubcollection(String uid, String subcollection, FirebaseCallback<ArrayList<String>> callback)
      Retrieves a subcollection of an event from the database. Calls the provided callback function when event has been received.

      Usage: getUserSubcollection(uid, "collection name", new FirebaseCallback<ArrayList<String>>() { 

      
      @Override
      public void onSuccess(ArrayList<String> result) {
          // define what to do with result
      }

      @Override
       public void onFailure(Exception e) {
                 // define what to do on failure case
             }
         );
  }
      Parameters:
      uid - string of user id to search for and retrieve all attributes
      subcollection - string of subcollection to retrieve
      callback - callback function to call when event is retrieved

    • getEventSubcollection

      public void getEventSubcollection(String eid, String subcollection, FirebaseCallback<ArrayList<String>> callback)
      Retrieves a subcollection of an event from the database. Calls the provided callback function when event has been received. 
      
 Usage: getEventSubcollection(eid, "collection name", new FirebaseCallback&lt;ArrayList&lt;String&gt;&gt;() {
      @Override
      public void onSuccess(ArrayList<String> result) {
          // define what to do with result
      }

      @Override
       public void onFailure(Exception e) {
                 // define what to do on failure case
             }
         });
      Parameters:
      eid - string of user id to search for and retrieve all attributes
      subcollection - string of subcollection to retrieve
      callback - callback function to call when event is retrieved

    • userAddStatus

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> userAddStatus(String uid, String eid, String subcollection)
      Adds a user to the requested list for an event in the database.
      Parameters:
      uid - User id
      eid - Event id
      subcollection - string of subcollection to retrieve

    • userRemoveStatus

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> userRemoveStatus(String uid, String eid, String subcollection)
      Removes a user from the requested list for an event in the database.
      Parameters:
      uid - User object containing all required attributes
      eid - Event object containing all required attributes
      subcollection - string of subcollection to retrieve

    • getQuery

      public void getQuery(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot lastVisible, com.google.firebase.firestore.Query query, FirebaseCallback<ArrayList<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentSnapshot>> callback)
      Retrieve a list of events from the database.
      Parameters:
      lastVisible - last visible event
      query - query to execute asynchronously
      callback - callback function to call when event is retrieved

      fileUri - Uri of the file to upload
      callback - callback function to call when event is retrieved

    • editPic

      public void editPic(android.net.Uri fileUri, String imageUrl, FirebaseCallback<String> callback)

      DOWNLOAD URL WILL CHANGE BECAUSE FIREBASE REGENS THE TOKEN

      Parameters:
      fileUri - Uri of the file to upload
